intro: Ricinocarpus benguelensis, commonly known as the Benguela spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly along the Atlantic coast of West Africa. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in sandy or coastal soils and is often found in dune environments. The species is noted for its ability to withstand saline and arid conditions, making it an important component of coastal vegetation.
